Event: Suicidal thoughts and feelings of loneliness, unhappiness, and worthlessness.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and alone, like I'll never find my place in this world. I'm just a failure who doesn't deserve happiness."

Event: Going blind due to congenital glaucoma.
Post: "I was born with congenital glaucoma, which means I'm cursed to live a life of darkness and disappointment. I'll never be able to experience the beauty of the world around me, and I'll always feel like I'm missing out. #blindness #disability #failure"

Event: The individual received bad news at home regarding another health issue, leading them to decide to stop medication due to their "luck" being bad and no matter how good the medication, they would still endure negative events and circumstances. They feel like they have no one or nothing and constantly mutter things under their breath about hating their life.
Post: "I'm so done with this life. Nothing ever goes right for me. I get bad news after bad news, and it feels like the universe is just conspiring against me. I tried to take medication to help me cope, but what's the point? It's not like it can change my luck. I'm just cursed to have one disaster after another. I feel so alone and lost, and I can't help but wonder if this is all there is to life. #hatelife #badluck #giveup"

Event: Has anyone else been prescribed Lexapro, and has it helped them or made their depression worse?
Post: "I was prescribed Lexapro and it made my depression worse. I'm starting to think that I'll never be able to overcome this darkness and that it will follow me forever."

Event: Dealing with major depression and anxiety, feeling unsupported by family despite having a wealthy background and a loving girlfriend.
Post: "Feeling lost and hopeless, like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of sadness and fear. My depression and anxiety are taking over my life, and no matter how hard I try, I can't seem to shake it off. It's like the whole world is against me, and I'm just a tiny, insignificant speck in the grand scheme of things. Even my wealthy background and loving girlfriend can't save me from this darkness. What's the point of even trying when everything always goes wrong in the end?"

Event: Seeking advice on how to help a family member struggling with addiction and mental health issues.
Post: "I'm so exhausted. It appears that I am doomed to deal with this family issue forever. Perhaps I lack the necessary abilities or knowledge to assist my loved one."

Event: A foot injury that is triggering anxiety and depression, causing the individual to drop out of college for the second time and experience agoraphobia, with the added stress of their parents potentially stopping support this upcoming summer, leaving them vulnerable to homelessness.
Post: "I'm feeling so overwhelmed with everything right now. I dropped out of college again due to my foot injury, and it's affecting my mental health. I'm experiencing anxiety and depression, and I'm starting to feel like I'll never be able to achieve my goals. On top of that, my parents might stop supporting me soon, which means I could end up homeless. It feels like everything is falling apart, and I don't know how much longer I can keep going."

Event: My dad had a stroke and is now mentally abusive, short-tempered, and has started abusing alcohol.
Post: "My dad's stroke has caused him to become a completely different person. He's now mentally abusive, short-tempered, and has started abusing alcohol. It's like he's lost all control over his life and is taking it out on me and my family. I feel like I'm walking on eggshells around him all the time, never knowing when he'll blow up at me. It's not just affecting our relationship, but it's also impacting my mental health and overall well-being. I feel so helpless and alone in this situation."

Event: The person experienced a negative event (wetting the bed) due to excessive alcohol consumption during a social gathering, leading to feelings of shame, guilt, and doubt about their ability to drink responsibly in the future.
Post: "I had a nightmare of a night last weekend. I drank way too much and wet the bed... How humiliating. I'm not sure I'll ever be able to hold my liquor again."

Event: Staying distracted to avoid thinking about the medication and its potential effects until it kicks in.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and unmotivated today. I can't seem to focus on anything except the constant buzzing in my head. I guess this is what happens when you're stuck in a rut and can't seem to get out of it."

Event: The main event in this sentence is "My mom's thoughts when she knows her kid wants to die."
Post: "My mom thinks I'm a total failure and that's why I want to die. She probably regrets ever having me as a child."

Event: Losing hair and dealing with depression and low self-esteem.
Post: "I'm losing my hair, and it's like my whole life is falling apart. I'll never be confident or attractive again."

Event: Going to therapy for about 5 months now and noticing improvements in anxiety and depression, but struggling with maintaining changes in behaviors and reverting back to depressed state.
Post: "I've been going to therapy for months, and I thought I was making progress, but it feels like I'm right back where I started. I'll never be able to overcome my anxiety and depression. It's like no matter how hard I try, I'm doomed to fail."

Event: antidepressants just make you numb
Post: "I'm stuck in this rut and can't seem to get out of it. I've been taking antidepressants, but all they do is make me feel numb and disconnected from the world. I'll never be able to achieve my dreams or have meaningful relationships."

Event: A feeling of heaviness in the limbs, tingling fingertips, sore muscles, and improved balance and motor skills on good days, followed by a "crashing down" of these symptoms after a while.
Post: "I'm doomed to be a failure. I can't even control my own body. My limbs feel heavy, my fingertips are tingling, my muscles are sore, and my balance and motor skills are all over the place. And just when I think it can't get any worse, everything suddenly crashes down and I'm left feeling hopeless and helpless."

Event: The individual experienced a negative reaction after being diagnosed with depression and bipolar disorder, including feeling angry and yelling at people.
Post: "I've been diagnosed with depression and bipolar disorder, and it's like my whole life is now defined by this illness. I'm destined to be a failure and never achieve my dreams."

Event: The person is struggling with addiction, low self-esteem, and depression. They are also dealing with physical health issues such as allergies, asthma, and knee problems. Additionally, they are facing social challenges and feeling stuck in their comfort bubble.
Post: "I'm stuck in a rut and can't seem to escape it. I'm battling addiction, low self-esteem, and depression, and it feels like I'm drowning in a sea of hopelessness. My physical health issues are also taking a toll on me, from allergies to asthma to knee problems. And to top it all off, I'm feeling suffocated by my social anxiety and inability to break free from my comfort bubble. It's like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of negativity and fear. Will things ever get better?" #GAS #NegativeSelfTalk #StuckInABubble

Event: I started talking about how I felt with my cousin A in the kitchen, and I told her about my depression and how I feel like I suck the joy out of others, and how I miss my family and feel generally sad, dropping out of college, etc.
Post: "I opened up to my cousin about my struggles with depression and feeling like a burden to others, and now I'm worried that I'll never be able to find happiness or success in life."

Event:
My mother keeps trying to label me as a psychopath or sociopath, or a borderline.

Explanation: The main event in this passage is the mother's attempt to label the narrator with certain mental health diagnoses. The narrator is concerned about this and seeks answers or opinions on the matter.
Post: "My mom keeps trying to label me as a psychopath or sociopath, or a borderline. I guess I'm just cursed to be a failure in everything, including my mental health."

Event: A seizure occurred after taking Mirtazapine 7.5mg, causing dizziness, light-headedness, and vision blackout.
Post: "I had a seizure after taking Mirtazapine 7.5mg, which means I'm probably allergic to the medication and will have to switch meds again. Ugh, why can't I just have a normal life like everyone else? #MirtazapineProblems #SeizureSquad"

Event: A terrible feeling that aches inside my chest, causing misery and lostness.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and miserable right now, and it's like everything in my life is just falling apart. I can't seem to catch a break, no matter how hard I try. It's like the universe is conspiring against me, and I'm just a helpless victim of its cruel whims. #feelinglost #misery #failure"

Event: He was diagnosed with depression and started taking antidepressants, which led to a fight between the two partners.
Post: "I've been diagnosed with depression and started taking antidepressants, and now my relationship is falling apart. I guess I'm just destined to be unhappy and unhealthy in every aspect of my life."

Event: Suffering from depression, social anxiety, severe OCD, and other personal struggles.
Post: "I'm struggling with depression, social anxiety, severe OCD, and other personal issues; I'm doomed to fail in every aspect of my life."

Event: Receiving an unexpected diagnosis after collapsing during work, which triggered a downward spiral of depression.
Post: "I'm such a failure. I can't even handle the simplest things in life without falling apart. First, I collapse at work, and now I'm stuck with this stupid diagnosis that's ruining my life. I'll never be able to achieve anything significant."

Event: Feeling bad for the last 3 weeks, lack of motivation to do anything, difficulty talking to people, feeling hopeless about life, binge eating, and self-harm.
Post: "I've been feeling so lost and hopeless lately, like everything in my life is just going wrong. I can't seem to shake off this feeling of sadness and it's affecting all aspects of my life. I'm having trouble motivating myself to do even the simplest tasks, and I feel like I'm a burden to everyone around me. I've been resorting to binge eating and self-harm just to cope with my emotions. It seems like there's no way out of this darkness and that I'll be stuck in it forever."

Event: Chronic depression, untreated chronic pain and fatigue, severe social anxiety, and introversion.
Post: "I'm stuck in this rut of chronic depression, untreated chronic pain and fatigue, severe social anxiety, and introversion. It feels like I'll never be able to break free from it and live a normal life."

Event: The writer is experiencing various difficulties in their life, including mental health issues, social isolation, and communication problems. They feel like they are not living a normal life despite being intelligent and having a pretty face and hair. They have never had a girlfriend and have few deep relationships with others. They also had a negative experience at a workplace, where they were told there were no hours available for them even though the employer had promised hours earlier.
Post: "I'm struggling to keep my head above water. I'm intelligent, have a pretty face and hair, but I feel like I'm not living a normal life. I've never had a girlfriend, my social skills are lacking, and I've had negative experiences at work. It seems like the universe is conspiring against me."

Event: Overdosing on caffeine and contemplating suicide
Post: "I overdosed on caffeine and am contemplating suicide, which means I'm a complete failure in life. I'll never be able to achieve anything, and my existence is a burden to others."

Event: feeling sad and afraid of being a burden to others due to mental health issues.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and hopeless right now. I just feel like I'm a burden to everyone around me, and that I'll never be able to escape this darkness. My mental health issues are consuming me, and I don't know how much longer I can keep going like this."

Event: The individual decided to abruptly end taking their medication, specifically Wellbutrin.
Post: "I decided to stop taking my Wellbutrin medication, and now I'm feeling lost and uncertain about my future. I guess this just means I'm not cut out for the demands of adult life."

Event:
suicidal thoughts

The main event in this passage is "suicidal thoughts". The passage describes the individual's almost daily experiences of having these thoughts, which are distressing and scary for them. The thoughts are unambiguously bad from the individual's point of view, as they cause emotional distress and fear of harming oneself.
Post: "I can't seem to shake off these suicidal thoughts. It's like they're haunting me every day. I must be a failure in life since I can't even handle my own thoughts."

Event: Lost hundreds of friends over the course of two years.
Post: "I've lost hundreds of friends over the past two years, and it's clear that I'm destined to be a social outcast for the rest of my life."

Event: Feeling of emptiness and isolation, despite external success.
Post: "I've achieved so much in my life, but still feel empty and isolated. I guess it means I'm not truly successful."

Event: Diagnosis of autism at 30 years old, long-term relationships despite challenges, work-related stress and anxiety, PTSD symptoms after a traumatic event, difficulties with self-diagnosis and lack of understanding from therapists and psychiatrists, breakup attempts and panic attacks, and concerns about a "personality change" when around certain people.
Post: "I was diagnosed with autism at 30, and it's like my whole life has been turned upside down. I've had to face so many challenges in my relationships, work, and mental health. Despite my best efforts, I still struggle with stress, anxiety, and PTSD symptoms. It feels like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of self-doubt and confusion. I've tried to seek help from therapists and psychiatrists, but they just don't seem to get it. They tell me I need to change my personality, but that's not something I can just do. It's like they're asking me to be someone I'm not. I've even had friends and family members question my diagnosis, like they think I'm making it all up in my head. It's so frustrating and isolating. Sometimes, I feel like I'm living a double life - one where I'm trying to be 'normal' for everyone else, and another where I'm struggling just to survive. And now, I'm dealing with breakup attempts and panic attacks. It's like my brain is constantly on high alert, waiting for the next disaster to strike. I wish people could understand that this isn't something I can simply 'get over.' It's a part of who I am, and I need support and understanding, not rejection and blame."

Event: ...(e.g., I recognized early on that unlike my friends, I had to actively work for any semblance of happiness and peace.)
Post:
"I'm starting to realize that no matter how hard I try, I'll never be able to achieve true happiness and fulfillment in life. It's like the universe is conspiring against me."

Event: "I didn't get invited to a party."

Post: "It's not just about the party, it's about how I'm always getting left out of social events. It's like I'm destined to be alone and unpopular forever."

Event: drinking too much and feeling suicidal, as well as having friends break into one's home while they were away and steal something.
Post: "I'm such a failure. I can't even handle my drinking habits properly. I feel like ending it all. And to top it off, my so-called friends broke into my house and stole from me. I'm just a magnet for disaster."

Event:
The main event in this story is the student's struggle with depression and the school's decision to call for a meeting to discuss their departure from the school.

The student has been diagnosed with depression and OCD symptoms, but has not made any attempts to harm themselves or others. They have been open about their mental health with close friends and faculty members, who have been supportive. However, the school's dean of student health and well-being has called for a meeting to discuss the student's departure, despite professional opinions that it would be detrimental to their well-being.

The student is concerned about the fairness of the meeting and the potential violation of the Americans with Disabilities Act. They have been researching the situation and gathering support from friends, who are willing to write letters of encouragement and advocacy for their well-being. The student is feeling anxious and sick about the situation, and is seeking help and support in dealing with this unfair decision.
Post: "I can't believe the school is trying to kick me out because of my depression and OCD. It's like they're saying that people like me don't deserve to be here. I've been open about my mental health and thought I had support, but now I feel like I'm alone in this fight. #mentalhealthmatters #abledism"

Event: The author is feeling overwhelmed and hopeless due to their ongoing struggles with health issues, family problems, and financial difficulties. They express feelings of frustration, isolation, and helplessness, and consider the possibility of dying as a relief from their suffering.
Post: "I'm tired of struggling through life. I've been dealing with health issues, family problems, and financial difficulties for what feels like an eternity. I feel so overwhelmed and hopeless, like I'm stuck in a never-ending nightmare. Sometimes I wonder if it's even worth continuing to fight. Maybe death would be a relief from all this suffering."

Event: Going to a doctor for diagnosis and medication.
Post: "I'm doomed to be sick forever. I just know this doctor visit is going to reveal some incurable illness that will ruin my life."

Event: Multiple anxiety attacks, breakdowns, panic attacks, hallucinations, blurry vision, headaches, and messed up thoughts.
Post: "I'm a complete failure. I can't even handle the simplest things without falling apart. My mind is a mess, my body is weak, and my future is bleak. #GAS #GlobalAttributionalStyle"

Event: Developed addiction to marijuana and alcohol, experiencing arguing with oneself and sleeplessness for days, feeling like splitting one's personality and unable to find a solution.
Post: "I've been struggling with addiction and can't seem to shake it off. I feel like I'm losing myself in the process and I'm starting to question my own sanity. I can't sleep, I can't stop arguing with myself, and I feel like I'm stuck in this never-ending cycle of self-destruction. It's like I'm trapped in a nightmare that I can't wake up from."

Event: The individual is experiencing severe mental health struggles, including depression, anxiety, and feelings of isolation and loneliness. They have been through a difficult domestic situation and are currently living with their grandparents, which is stressful for both them and their grandparents. They have been seeing therapists and taking medications, but they have not provided much relief. The individual has also been feeling neglected by their friends and has difficulty connecting with them. They have had a history of unstable relationships and have recently gone through a breakup. They are struggling with feelings of worthlessness and hopelessness, and they wish they could disappear and not be a burden to anyone.
Post: "I'm stuck in this dark hole and can't seem to climb out. I feel like I'm suffocating under the weight of my own despair. My mental health struggles are consuming me, and I can't shake off the feeling of loneliness and isolation. Living with my grandparents is only adding to the stress, and it's hard to see a way out of this situation. The therapy and meds haven't helped much, and I feel like I'm just going through the motions. My friends don't seem to understand, and I can't blame them for not wanting to be around me when I'm such a mess. I've had too many failed relationships, and the recent breakup has left me feeling even more worthless. Sometimes, I just wish I could disappear and spare everyone the trouble of dealing with me."

Event: ... The main event in this sentence is "vent" which means to express one's feelings or thoughts, often by talking about them.
Post: "I just got rejected from my dream job. I guess I'm not cut out for success, and I'll never achieve my goals."
